creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: bowl, octagonal, eight reserve panels each with Dutch and Chinese men in various poses; blue underglaze and polychromed overglaze on porcelain. Marked on bottom
medium: Imari ware; porcelain with underglaze blue and overglaze enamels
text: When political turmoil in China prevented Dutch traders from filling European orders for decorative porcelains, they turned to the budding porcelain industry in Japan. From the mid-1600s to the mid-1700s, vast quantities of brilliantly colored wares were shipped abroad. At the same time, the Japanese themselves developed a taste for porcelain. This bowl, with its amusing depictions of exotic foreigners, was undoubtedly made for the domestic market.
title: Bowl with Dutch and Chinese Figures
